full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 177 of 236 1081
LC3KMAX6 Parkinson - Direct
1 Special Agent Maguire was going to offer that I don't believe is being objected to.
2
3 Never mind, your Honor, I'm being told -- never mind.
4 THE COURT: All right.
5 With respect to the items, either the physical items or the photographs of the school costumes, as I indicated - and
6
7 I think the ruling I'm making now is fully consistent with that - it has to be tied through a witness as to similarity of items
8 seen at the time. And that was what I ruled before about those, which is why you can lay the foundation through Maguire,
9 and if it's temporally tied back, I imagine I would admit it, depending on that testimony; same theory here.
10
11 MR. EVERDELL: Yes, your Honor.
12 MS. COMEY: Understood, your Honor. Thank you.
13
14 THE COURT: All right.
15
16 Are these for me or for the witness?
17 MR. EVERDELL: Those are for you, your Honor.
18 THE COURT: Okay. Thank you.
19 MR. EVERDELL: It should be three, for the next three witnesses. Sorry I couldn't get one for your Honor's deputy.
20
21 THE COURT: All right. So we can bring the witness back and we can get the jury.
22
23 THE WITNESS: Good afternoon, your Honor.
24 THE COURT: Good afternoon, Mr. Parkinson. You may take your seat. Thank you.
25
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00018278
